column4: I have trouble with beryl. Till now, I used fglrx+xgl+beryl, and it worked nice. Except the fact that xgl is a dirty hack and prevents other things from working right. Now I finally installed the opensource radeon driver, and run xorg+aiglx+beryl on that. However, it runs very slow, and makes it nearly unusable. gnome-panel eats up around 80% CPU.
the opensource radeon drivers aren't necessarilly the fastest thing you can get, is it unusually slow?
and eats up all my CPU power just by sitting there.
